comments: Looks like a bug crept into the nightly build (N20060613) in that I cannot create a new Data Set for a report.  Each time I try to select "Finish" I get the attached message.

Created an attachment (id=44402)
screenshot of error

This bug might be in designer side, since such a widget dispose exception can be thrown by the data explorer tree. You will find if you create another report design, such an issue does not exist. Please restart your eclipse as a work around.

Can any one provide the log file to help us know if the exception in the tree or in the wizard?
I think the tree can not be disposed in this case.

It is strange that if your create another report design file without restarting eclipse, there is no any problem. So why it will occur is because there is something wrong in current report design. We find if we switch this current design file from UI to XML source, it can not be opened again in UI. Above information might be of help.
If that's the case, I think possibly some changes in the date set editor crashed the design file.
You can not easily to tell the data set editor crash the file.

I just said possibly.
Or on other words, can we try to figure out why the file be crashed then?

Created an attachment (id=44476)
design file used to reproduce this bug

How can we get thie error file then?
What operations did you do?

This is a bug that rarely happens.
It can't simply be reproduced by using the somehow broken design file somewhere else or restarting BIRT locally.
One thing though, there could be certain excpetions that won't be written to the error log, this is definitely one of them.

(In reply to comment #2)
> This bug might be in designer side, since such a widget dispose exception can
> be thrown by the data explorer tree. You will find if you create another report
> design, such an issue does not exist. Please restart your eclipse as a work
> around.
> 

Restarting Eclipse works for me.  From that point forward, I do not get the error. You can close this defect or mark is as a low priority bug to fix in the future.

After reviewing the code with Max, i suggested to change some calling sequence to avoid potential event issues.
I suggest to do that change and schedule this bug to future. If we don't face this issue again for a long time, then we can close it.
Lower its severity. The investigation is still going on.
This bug is difficult to reproduce, but we still think this bug still exists. We will add a line of log code to find what the real problem is when this error happens again.
We need to wait for the time when the bug happens again. We have done a static code review, and found nothing.
Moved to 2.1.1 since this does not appear to be a consistent error and can be worked around.

Happened when refreshValues in BindingPage

This is caused by did not remove BindingPage listener from ModuleHandle when switch editor to another.

The error occurs only after switching editors when BindingPage is active.

Code committed in 2006.6.23, you can test it with any dailly build after 2006.6.23.
